fact_check_explanation_title: Other funerals have not been banned on day of the Queen’s funeral
fact_check_explanation_summary: The government has not issued specific advice on funerals scheduled for the day of the Queen’s funeral. Funeral service providers say some services have been cancelled at the request of …

fact_check_explanation_title: Wetherspoons has not stopped selling condoms for a ‘royal period of mourning’
fact_check_explanation_summary: The pub chain confirmed that a sign suggesting its vending machines were closed is fake, and said it doesn’t have condom vending machines anyway.

fact_check_explanation_title: Russell Brand admits falsely claiming that ivermectin is a Covid-19 treatment
fact_check_explanation_summary: A page of the National Institutes of Health website says that ivermectin is not recommended, and does not work, as a treatment for Covid-19.

fact_check_explanation_title: Viral video does not show the Queen throwing food at 'African' children
fact_check_explanation_summary: A video circulating on social media shows French women throwing coins at a group of children, and was filmed long before the Queen was born.
Most of England’s cities are not “majority non-white” as an Instagram post has claimed. The latest data we have shows that none are.

fact_check_explanation_title: Claim that 44% of Pfizer Covid-19 vaccine trial pregnancies ended in miscarriage is wrong
fact_check_explanation_summary: The number is based on miscalculation from a now-deleted blog post.

fact_check_explanation_title: Boris Johnson’s final speech as PM: fact checked
fact_check_explanation_summary: We’ve checked six key claims from Boris Johnson’s final speech as Prime Minister, on the vaccine rollout, NHS, schools and more.

fact_check_explanation_title: The government hasn’t ‘removed’ Covid-19 vaccine advice in pregnancy
fact_check_explanation_summary: Claims seem to be based on a document published around the time the Pfizer vaccine was first approved.

fact_check_explanation_title: Telegraph miscalculates the cost of working from home
fact_check_explanation_summary: Its estimate that on average working from home will add £2,500 a year to energy bills was flawed, and there are other questions around its calculations too.

fact_check_explanation_title: Report of abandoned newborn babies around the country are false
fact_check_explanation_summary: Images of a newborn baby supposedly abandoned in several English towns and cities were actually taken in Thailand in 2017.

fact_check_explanation_title: Boris Johnson’s kettle comments taken out of context
fact_check_explanation_summary: An out-of-context clip of the Prime Minister talking about savings from buying a new kettle appears to have been an attempt at an analogy about nuclear power.

fact_check_explanation_title: Innovative bus driver strike in Japan is not ‘currently’ happening
fact_check_explanation_summary: Industrial action by drivers in Okayama ended in May 2018.
